title: Modified 2006 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package 6-Speed
description: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six fitted with a Schrick camshaft, an Evolve carbon-fiber airbox, and Dinan throttle bodies and linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential with 4.10:1 gearing. Finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic, the car is further equipped with a carbon-fiber roof, a CSL-style trunk lid, and a Vorsteiner front bumper cover and rear diffuser along with 18" HRE Fall-Line R43 wheels, Brembo brakes, AST coilovers, custom headers, and Supersprint exhaust components. The cabin features Sparco SPX bucket seats as well as a CAE shifter, an Alcantara-trimmed steering wheel, and drilled metal pedals. Acquired by the seller in 2021, this E46 M3 has 89k miles and is offered in California with an owner's manual, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean South Dakota title in the seller's name.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a Modified 2006 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package 6-Speed at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #176,834.
text: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six fitted with a Schrick camshaft, an Evolve carbon-fiber airbox, and Dinan throttle bodies and linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential with 4.10:1 gearing. Finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic, the car is further equipped with a carbon-fiber roof, a CSL-style trunk lid, and a Vorsteiner front bumper cover and rear diffuser along with 18″ HRE Fall-Line R43 wheels, Brembo brakes, AST coilovers, custom headers, and Supersprint exhaust components. The cabin features Sparco SPX bucket seats as well as a CAE shifter, an Alcantara-trimmed steering wheel, and drilled metal pedals. Acquired by the seller in 2021, this E46 M3 has 89k miles and is offered in California with an owner’s manual, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean South Dakota title in the seller’s name. The car is finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic (A30) with Shadowline trim, and the seller states that it has been fitted with a Vorsteiner V-CSL front bumper cover, a Lang Racing carbon-fiber roof, a CSL-style trunk lid, a Vorsteiner carbon-fiber rear diffuser, and N15 Design hood vents. Additional details include a front tow strap, a carbon-fiber front splitter, LED tail lights, and quad exhaust outlets. Paint protection film has been applied to the roof according to the seller. The 18″ HRE Fall-Line R43 wheels are mounted with 245/40 front and 275/35 rear Bridgestone Potenza RE-71R5S tires. Modifications noted by the seller include a Brembo GT brake kit, a Rogue Engineering front strut brace, AST 4200 coilovers, Vorshlag camber plates, and Motorsport Hardware wheel studs and lug nuts. A pair of Sparco SPX bucket seats with carbon-fiber backs have been added to the cabin, and additional interior details include a CAE shifter, drilled metal pedals, a Harman Kardon sound system, automatic climate control, and an Alcantara-trimmed shift boot and center armrest. There are dead pixels in the infotainment display and the Alcantara headliner is sagging. The Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 89k miles, approximately 5k of which were added under current ownership. The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is said to have been modified with a Schrick 288/280 camshaft set, an Evolve carbon-fiber airbox, Dinan throttle bodies, Ferrea Racing valves, BE rod bearings, and a Besian Vanos upgrade. The seller states that the motor has been resealed and the alternator has been replaced. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Rogue Engineering rear shock mount reinforcements were installed in 2010 according to the seller, who notes that the car is equipped with AKG Motorsport rear subframe bushings and a rebuilt differential with 4.10:1 gearing and ARP bolts. Custom headers and Supersprint exhaust components are also said to be installed. The Carfax report notes at least one open recall. This 2006 BMW M3 coupe is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six fitted with a Schrick camshaft, an Evolve carbon-fiber airbox, and Dinan throttle bodies and linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential with 4.10:1 gearing. Finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic, the car is further equipped with a carbon-fiber roof, a CSL-style trunk lid, and a Vorsteiner front bumper cover and rear diffuser along with 18″ HRE Fall-Line R43 wheels, Brembo brakes, AST coilovers, custom headers, and Supersprint exhaust components. The cabin features Sparco SPX bucket seats as well as a CAE shifter, an Alcantara-trimmed steering wheel, and drilled metal pedals. Acquired by the seller in 2021, this E46 M3 has 89k miles and is offered in California with an owner’s manual, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean South Dakota title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic (A30) with Shadowline trim, and the seller states that it has been fitted with a Vorsteiner V-CSL front bumper cover, a Lang Racing carbon-fiber roof, a CSL-style trunk lid, a Vorsteiner carbon-fiber rear diffuser, and N15 Design hood vents. Additional details include a front tow strap, a carbon-fiber front splitter, LED tail lights, and quad exhaust outlets. Paint protection film has been applied to the roof according to the seller.

The 18″ HRE Fall-Line R43 wheels are mounted with 245/40 front and 275/35 rear Bridgestone Potenza RE-71R5S tires. Modifications noted by the seller include a Brembo GT brake kit, a Rogue Engineering front strut brace, AST 4200 coilovers, Vorshlag camber plates, and Motorsport Hardware wheel studs and lug nuts.

A pair of Sparco SPX bucket seats with carbon-fiber backs have been added to the cabin, and additional interior details include a CAE shifter, drilled metal pedals, a Harman Kardon sound system, automatic climate control, and an Alcantara-trimmed shift boot and center armrest. There are dead pixels in the infotainment display and the Alcantara headliner is sagging.

The Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 89k miles, approximately 5k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is said to have been modified with a Schrick 288/280 camshaft set, an Evolve carbon-fiber airbox, Dinan throttle bodies, Ferrea Racing valves, BE rod bearings, and a Besian Vanos upgrade. The seller states that the motor has been resealed and the alternator has been replaced.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Rogue Engineering rear shock mount reinforcements were installed in 2010 according to the seller, who notes that the car is equipped with AKG Motorsport rear subframe bushings and a rebuilt differential with 4.10:1 gearing and ARP bolts. Custom headers and Supersprint exhaust components are also said to be installed.

The Carfax report notes at least one open recall.

The vehicle cannot pass a California emissions test in its current configuration, therefore it cannot be sold to an in-state private party buyer.
